result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Letter to Judge with Stipulation and Order

Court calls @ 2:04 PM/Rm. 301, 19CF17, 21CF9, 21CF350 and 22CF177. Defendant Christine E. Pelky appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court for Christine E. Pelky.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history's, 19CF17, 21CF9 and 21CF350 all set for status conferences, 22CF177 set for adjourned initial appearance. Atty Laufenberg has received copies of criminal complaints, waives readings and will need to schedule court date for bond modification. Atty Laufenberg waives time limits for P.H. Def. agrees to waive time limits of P.H. Court accepts waiver of time limits.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Christine E. Pelky
Current: 301 S. 1st Ave., Wausau, WI 54403 United States  (Effective: 09-22-2022)
Prior: N1982 Crestwood Road, Antigo, WI 54409

Maintain Absolute Sobriety. 
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances. 
No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.

1:44 PM Defendant Christine E. Pelky appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given Atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own, court appointed Atty. or represent self.  State gives bail bond recommendations and requests $10,000.00 cash bond with conditions to Maintain Absolute Sobriety, No illegal use or possession of controlled substances and No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. State notes non monetary conditions are also apart of other bond and Def. is currently on a probation hold. Def. gives bail bond argument and requests treatment. Court considers bail bond factors and orders an $8,000.00 cash bond with conditions to Maintain Absolute Sobriety, No illegal use or possession of controlled substances and No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. State requests other cases, 19CF17, 21CF9, 21CF350 track along with case. Court orders.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
